events.message: Customer reported a car collision that occurred on April 30th, causing damage to the rear bumper and rear left door. Claim has been officially filed in the system.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident based on keywords indicating vehicle collision and damage to the car's exterior parts.
An agent specialized in automobile insurance was assigned to handle the case and to guide the customer through next steps promptly.
The claim has been acknowledged and the customer received confirmation that their case is being processed by the insurance company.
Request sent to the customer for submission of accident photos, police report, and vehicle registration papers to move forward with the investigation.
Customer submitted all required documents including photos of the damaged vehicle, police accident report, and ownership registration.
Investigation has commenced to assess the extent of the damage and verify details of the accident from submitted evidence and police records.
Investigation completed with inspection confirming the damage to rear left door and bumper requiring repair and paint work.
Based on repair estimates, a settlement amount covering parts and labor was proposed to the customer for approval.
Customer responded positively, agreeing to the proposed settlement and requesting quick processing of payment.
The claim approval was finalized internally, confirming that all criteria were met and settlement terms accepted.
The settlement amount was issued to the customer’s bank account to cover the car repair costs.
Claim was officially closed after payment issuance and confirmation that the customer’s vehicle has been repaired satisfactorily.
